授業目的:
＜Lecture＞ This is a supported lecture course so students will listen to a lecture in English that is supported by vocabulary and skills development. The lectures are based on the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) and will also provide the topics for the reading and discussion and writing courses described below.
＜Lecture Bridge Reading and Discussion＞ The purpose of this course is to help students develop their academic discussion and research skills. Students will use input from the lecture, readings and their own research to discuss SDG-related topics.
到達目標:
<Lecture> Students will improve: English lecture listening skills, reading and research skills, note-taking and vocabulary knowledge.
<Lecture Bridge Reading and Discussion> Students will be able to discuss SDG-related topics, discuss topics from a problem-solution perspective, hold extended discussions on a topic, and used discussion strategies to manage discussions.
特記事項: 本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。 The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
授業方法: <all> Materials, instruction, and all class communication are in English. Course materials will be available to students through LUNA.

トピック.授業計画1:
*All 14 classes will be conducted face-to-face.
<Lecture> Each topic will be introduced on a three-week cycle following a problem - solution genre. The first week, will introduce an SDG, providing background information and important definitions. The second week will address the causes of the problem and the interrelatedness of the topic with other SDGs. The third week will introduce a solution to the problem and discuss its successes and limitations. <Lecture Bridge Reading and Discussion> Materials and topics will follow the lecture course while also introducing discussion skills and improving vocabulary knowledge.
トピック.授業外学習2: <Lecture> Students will read and complete preparation worksheets for each lecture. Students will need to review materials for a midterm and final exam. ＜Lecture Bridge Reading and Discussion＞ To prepare for the discussions, students will read articles, attend the lectures, and research the topic on the Internet. In the discussions, they present, discuss, and explore the topics based on the lecture, reading, and research.

評価.教科書Required texts0: <Lecture Bridge Courses> Materials will be available on LUNA. You should bring your materials to class on your device (computer / tablet) or print and bring paper copies. If you do not bring a device, you should also bring a dictionary to class.

評価.成績評価Grading2:
備考　Note
<Lecture> The grade will be based on a midterm, final and in-class quizzes. The quizzes are pop-quizzes. This means they are not announced before the class. If a student is absent, these quizzes cannot be made up. Instead, each students' lowest quiz grade will be dropped so that students can miss one quiz without it affecting their final grade.
＜Lecture Bridge Reading and Discussion＞ Students are assessed on this course by regular group discussion tests, discussion preparation, independent research and a learning diary.
